intro: Encyclia varicosa var. leiobolbon, commonly known as the yellow-stemmed orchid, is a species native to Central America. It is a terrestrial orchid with a compact growth habit and produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and has lanceolate, dark green leaves with a waxy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its unique floral structure and coloration make it a distinctive member of the Orchidaceae family.
